Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.<CM>
He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but <FI>he that is<Fi> perverse in his ways despiseth him.<CM>
In the mouth of the foolish <FI>is<Fi> a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.<CM>
Where no oxen <FI>are<Fi>, the crib <FI>is<Fi> clean: but much increase <FI>is<Fi> by the strength of the ox.<CM>
A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.<CM>
A scorner seeketh wisdom, and <FI>findeth it<Fi> not: but knowledge <FI>is<Fi> easy unto him that understandeth.<CM>
Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not <FI>in him<Fi> the lips of knowledge.<CM>
The wisdom of the prudent <FI>is<Fi> to understand his way: but the folly of fools <FI>is<Fi> deceit.<CM>
Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous <FI>there is<Fi> favour.<CM>
The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.<RF>his own…: Heb. the bitterness of his soul<Rf><CM>
The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.<CM>
There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof <FI>are<Fi> the ways of death.<CM>
Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth <FI>is<Fi> heaviness.<CM>
The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man <FI>shall be satisfied<Fi> from himself.<CM>
The simple believeth every word: but the prudent <FI>man<Fi> looketh well to his going.<CM>
A wise <FI>man<Fi> feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.<CM>
<FI>He that is<Fi> soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.<CM>
The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.<CM>
The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.<CM>
The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich <FI>hath<Fi> many friends.<RF>the rich…: Heb. many are the lovers of the rich<Rf><CM>
He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy <FI>is<Fi> he.<CM>
Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth <FI>shall be<Fi> to them that devise good.<CM>
In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips <FI>tendeth<Fi> only to penury.<CM>
The crown of the wise <FI>is<Fi> their riches: <FI>but<Fi> the foolishness of fools <FI>is<Fi> folly.<CM>
A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful <FI>witness<Fi> speaketh lies.<CM>
In the fear of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
The fear of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.<CM>
In the multitude of people <FI>is<Fi> the king's honour: but in the want of people <FI>is<Fi> the destruction of the prince.<CM>
<FI>He that is<Fi> slow to wrath <FI>is<Fi> of great understanding: but <FI>he that is<Fi> hasty of spirit exalteth folly.<RF>hasty…: Heb. short of spirit<Rf><CM>
A sound heart <FI>is<Fi> the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.<CM>
He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.<CM>
The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.<CM>
Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but <FI>that which is<Fi> in the midst of fools is made known.<CM>
Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin <FI>is<Fi> a reproach to any people.<RF>to any…: Heb. to nations<Rf><CM>
The king's favour <FI>is<Fi> toward a wise servant: but his wrath is <FI>against<Fi> him that causeth shame.<CM>
